problem: Simplify $\frac{\sqrt{2}}{\sqrt{5}} \cdot \frac{\sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{6}} \cdot \frac{\sqrt{4}}{\sqrt{7}}$ and rationalize the denominator of the resulting fraction.
solution: The problem is to simplify $\frac{\sqrt{2}\cdot\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{4}}{\sqrt{5}\cdot\sqrt{6}\cdot\sqrt{7}}$. Writing $\sqrt{6}$ as $\sqrt{2}\cdot\sqrt{3}$ shows that it is possible to cancel a $\sqrt{2}$ and a $\sqrt{3}$ top and bottom. Also, simplify $\sqrt{4}$ to $2$. This gives $\frac{2}{\sqrt{5}\cdot\sqrt{7}} = \frac{2}{\sqrt{35}}$. Finally, to rationalize the denominator, multiply top and bottom by $\sqrt{35}$ to get $\boxed{\frac{2\sqrt{35}}{35}}$.
chatgpt_solution: First, when simplifying a product of square-root terms, we can combine the square roots of a product by taking the square root of the product of the radicands. For example $\sqrt{10} \cdot \sqrt{2} = \sqrt{10 \cdot 2} = \sqrt{20}$. Using this method, the terms in the given expression simplify to $\sqrt{\frac{2}{5}} \cdot \sqrt{\frac{3}{6}} \cdot \sqrt{\frac{4}{7}}.$ Also, note that $\sqrt{\frac{a}{b}} = \frac{\sqrt{a}}{\sqrt{b}}$ for all positive integers $a$ and $b$. Hence the product simplifies to \[\frac{\sqrt{2}}{\sqrt{5}} \cdot \frac{\sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{6}} \cdot \frac{\sqrt{4}}{\sqrt{7}} = \sqrt{\frac{2}{5}} \cdot \sqrt{\frac{3}{6}} \cdot \sqrt{\frac{4}{7}} = \left(\frac{\sqrt{2}}{\sqrt{5}}\right) \left(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{6}}\right) \left(\frac{\sqrt{4}}{\sqrt{7}}\right) = \frac{\sqrt{2}}{\sqrt{5}} \cdot \frac{\sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{6}} \cdot \frac{\sqrt{4}}{\sqrt{7}}.\] The product of the three terms $\frac{\sqrt{2}}{\sqrt{5}} \cdot \frac{\sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{6}} \cdot \frac{\sqrt{4}}{\sqrt{7}}$ has a denominator of $\sqrt{5\cdot 6 \cdot 7},$ and a numerator of $\sqrt{2 \cdot 3 \cdot 4} = \sqrt{24}.$ Thus \[\frac{\sqrt{2}}{\sqrt{5}} \cdot \frac{\sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{6}} \cdot \frac{\sqrt{4}}{\sqrt{7}} = \frac{\sqrt{2\cdot 3 \cdot 4}}{\sqrt{5\cdot 6 \cdot 7}} = \boxed{\frac{\sqrt{24}}{\sqrt{210}}}.\]
